Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a quiet but central location.”
Reviews.Author: GWC13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with breakfast included. This is a smart hotel for the money. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and of good quality. Our room was quite spacious as was the bathroom. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and clean, but low in security”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel_Sham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the Diagonal metro exit. The room is clean and spacious. The Internet connection is reasonably fast. The staff can be more courteous and helpful. All is acceptable except its security - there is basically no security as anyone can go into the hotel lobby without being questioned. We lost a handbag in the hotel lobby while checking in at the counter. Tourists beware!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: beenthereVancouver
Reviews.Content: Wow! what a gem. Best location ever, metro across the street. Lots of bars, restaurants, shopping, and Spanish made leather shoes, handbags. Room was very large, very clean and true to the pictures posted on the internet. The staff very helpful and courteous. Arrived at 10:00am after a cruise, and not problem storing our luggage until our room was ready. One of the quietest rooms I've ever stayed in when traveling thru Spain. Our room faced the street, but no noise because of the large double windows. Definitely worth the money and will stay here again. Better than being on the noise Ramblas, just take the metro or you can even walk to it because hotel is that close and central.

Reviews.Title: “Gallery Hotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: teslglobal
Reviews.Content: We booked for a night at the Alexandro Barcelona Hotel but was told upon arrival that we would be staying at Gallery Hotel. They paid for the cab to get us there and we were given a beautiful suite. The furniture and carpeting was a bit outdated but it was nevertheless a beautiful place facing an inner courtyard, away from traffic noise on the street. we were also given free breakfast at the Alexandro Barcelona Hotel. I would highly recommend the Gallery Hotel as it is situated in the nice part of town and close to all the Gaudi buildings on Passeig Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel staff were warm and friendly, speaking fluent English. The rooms were large, spacious and bright with the bathroom following with the trend. The bed was comfortable and a good nights sleep was easy. Then upon waking, the breakfast buffet was good; with a wide range of food: both hot and cold available. For the price it was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for the weekend at The Gallery Hotel, as previously stated excellent location, clean and well staffed, probably could do with a bit of TLC but nothing that would put you off, breakfast very good and a nice little reasonably priced bar as well, will definitely use this hotel again on our next visit to Barca and our stay has tempted us to try their sister hotel in Malaga as well

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Metro (Diagonal) and walking distance to the Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Frank-1972-06
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice & helpfull people at the hotel. However the price pr. night is over the top. I can recommend the cafe just across the street for breakfast and/or sandwich!

Reviews.Title: “efficient and satisfying hotel”
Reviews.Author: winst0n4
Reviews.Content: The Gallery hotel proved both efficient and pleasant in all respects. The room was large and comfortable, the wifi worked, and the hotel's location could hardly be bettered, in a fashionable shopping and restaurant district. Better still, the hotel has a first-class restaurant, which does a modern take on Catalan food. Finally, and to us most important, the breakfasts were simply excellent. We should note that the price was very right indeed, so the whole package was a real bargain. We should however also note that the warnings about thievery in Barcelona should never be forgotten, as it (almost) happened to us only a block from this hotel, in a most respectable district.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been to privately”
Reviews.Author: Stavrospgr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has: 1) ideal location: next to Pedrera, next to Metro, quiet high-class neighborhood 2) FANTASTIC people: very helpful, good English 3) fantastic breakfast: Nespresso coffee, freshly squeezed juice (at least tasted like it!), great omelet, nice selection of tapas, good croissants (with black chocolate, white chocolate and no chocolate :) ), fruits, VERY HELPFUL personnel during breakfast 4) big room, big bathroom, air-condition working efficiently and without noise 5) VERY CLEAN in all areas 6) VERY FAIR PRICED If you are going to Barcelona and do not intend to spend more than 150 euro for Hotel, it is one of the best choice (for me the BEST and will recommend it to all my friends. Bravo Gallery!!!

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: RosanaSpinelli
Reviews.Content: I nave been with my family last week at Gallery Hotel. I really loved it! The check in was fast and efficient. The young lady who helped us was very nice. We were there before 14h00, and the rooms were ready. It was a nice surprise, because we were coming from Andorra and were a little tired. The rooms were confort, of good size and clean. The hotel has a free wifi, a gold plus! We found chocolates and a bootle of water as a courtesy. if you like music, you´ll find a cd to listen and relax. The location is great...a few steps to Passeio de Gracia and the most elegant shops, La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. The breakfast was good with fresh fruits, a lot of different breads, yougurths, cereals, Nespresso coffee, pastries, and several types of hams and cheeses. You can seat at the terrace to take your breakfast. I loved everything and have nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Coffee”
Reviews.Author: sharkyuae
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here and well situated geographically within Barcelona for walking around. Rooms were not ready when we arrived and we only managed to get changed for our business meetings at the last minute in a toilet without having the luxury to shower before changing. Breakfast is good with Nespresso coffee, lunch service a bit laid back and bar service in the evening too slow, staff not attentive enough to recognize more drinks are required for people joining a group and we usually decided to just get up and go out. Rooms are quite small, and bathrooms are cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Janetix86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it as our last Europe stop. One of the best we came across. Amazing breakfast with great coffee pod machine and pastries !! I always grabbed some for the road- delish! Room and bathroom were gorgeous and well lit for long sleeps. Highly recommend, oh, and such a short walk to main strip!

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: William_Brennan
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for all the main sights but just far enough off the beaten track to be wonderfully quiet. Decent breakfast if you can get it at a reasonable rate. Very good Thai restaurant (Thai Gracia) not very far away. There have been some comments on this site about patchy WiFi, but I found it worked fine - the only problem is that the desk staff tend to sign you up only for a few hours or a day at a time. If you ask them to sign you up for your full stay on arrival, there shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: devontourers
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Barcelona and we were pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was in an excellent neighbourhood with all of the expensive shops - Chanel, Jimmy Choo, Armani etc within a two minute walk. There are also a number of the more famous Gaudi buildings within five minutes. The hotel though is situated about15 minutes from Catalunya square and the top of Las Ramblas and we found ourselves walking up and down a couple of times a day - yes we could have used the Metro but that seemed to take longer if you didn't hit the right train. Breakfast and was more than adequate - cereal, bacon, scrambled egg, toast and all the usual continental cheeses and meats etc. Other comments indicated that it wasn't worth 20 euro and we would agree but that is the price that you pay in any big city. Our deal was breakfast inclusive and we paid £141 per night for a superior room which we considered to be good value. Staff are friendly and English speaking and more than happy to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stefano006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located between Paseo de Gracia and Rambla Catalunya. The Metro is very close but to reach the Rambla and the Gothic area is a very nice walking. Hotel is very good in everything. People at the reception are kind and efficients. I have been several time in this hotel and it has been always a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gallery Hotel- Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Yamitt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location near Pg de Gracia and a walking distance from the Rambla and the Gothic quarter. There are two good resturant near by and a backary. The service was exellent. They supplied us with a nice crib for our baby and were always trying to assist where ever they could. The breakfast is not worth 20 euros though for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona and Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweettours
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel September 3rd thru September 8th and loved the hotel and location. The staff were very friendly and the rooms clean and spacious. Only draw back was the internet was not working properly and constantly had to be reset.....but who needs the internet when you have wonderful beautiful Barcelona at your feet!! Avenue Catalunya was a few steps away with it's lovely sidewalk cafes and a few blocks the other direction was Passeig de Gracia with it's lovely cafes, shopping and Gaudi architecture. The Metro was just a few steps from the door of the hotel. We left for 5 days in Paris and only wanted to return immediately back to Barcelona....we will return to this great property and wonderful city!!!! Thanks Gallery Hotel and Barcelona for a memorable 30th wedding anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ankime
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for 2 nights in this hotel during July 2011. The hotel has an excellent location- 50m from Passeig de Gracia with access to metro station. The hotel is very nice and the personnel extremely helpful. The rooms are spatious and nicely decorated I would highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, luxurious, and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: dweitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is one block from Gaudi's Pedrera, and a 10 min. walk to the Plaza de Catalunya, and the top of the Ramblas. Beds were very comfortable. Buffet breakfast was very complete. There is a metro stop on the corner, and a Starbucks too. Metro is very easy to navigate. I might add that the street is like 5th Ave. in NYC with some very expensive clothing stores i.e. Prada, Gucci, etc. This served as a base for our extensive exploration of Barcelona, which included all of the Gaudi buildings (Sagrada Familia is a must see), the Picasso and Miro museums, and several parks. Ramblas was a bit crowded and somewhat cheezy, but it's a good place for gelato and experiencing the sea of humanity. Barcelona felt more like NYC (where I grew up) than any other place we were at in Spain, especially in the variety of people there. Our room was on the 3rd floor, and faced the central courtyard. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Business Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Gallery Hotel from Aug 2nd to the 15th. I had a very nice Superior Room on the 4th floor. The Room was very large with all of the amenities. The Beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and the service was very good. The location is very close to the Diagonal metro stop. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Barcelona is loaded with many nice hotels but this one's room size is what makes it a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for seeing the sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Friend-in-the-North
Reviews.Content: We took our teenage son for a five night trip to Barcelona and stayed in the Gallery Hotel. The Hotel is well located in the Eixample district, a short walk to Casa Mila and Casa Batllo and about a 25 minute walk to the Sagrada Familia. The front of house staff were very cheerful and the room air conditioning was much appreciated given the temperatures outside. The room was clean and spacious enough for the 3 of us. We didnt breakfast in the Hotel, preferring to get out early and use one or two of the excellent patisseries on the Street. We had the Menu of the Day in the Hotel one evening and felt it was of a high standard and good value for money - we paid a lot more for worse meals elsewhere in Barcelona. The only minor gripes are that the fitness centre at the top of the building has no air conditioning and that the bar staff were a little slow to come forward and although there was a telephone on the roof terrace so that drinks could be ordered, sometimes there was nobody picking up the phone. That apart, it was an enjoyable stay and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it. I would also mention that we had a lovely meal at a restaurant nearby called Igueldo (186 Rosello). It wasnt cheap but the food was excellent and a cut above the usual on offer.

Reviews.Title: “A sound central choice”
Reviews.Author: APWLondon
Reviews.Content: Nothing amazing but good on the basics of a business hotel in a good downtown location

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeandlynne069
Reviews.Content: in good location very comforable rooms and very helpful staff. food and beverages very good and well priced. Would certainly stay here again and certainly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, service goes the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: ruienc
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early in the morning (9am) and immediately my room was available! Not only available, but was upgraded to room suite.... with a large living room, bedroom and 2 bathrooms (one without bathtube or shower) Hotel is very quiet, and reception works in a very efficient way. As far as I understood all staff speaks decent english. Location is great, 50m from Passeo Gracia, 100m from sightseen bus stop and 150m from La Pedrera. I didnt spend much time at hotel during my stay, so I cannot comment on restaurant and breakfast (there is a starbucks 50m away for breakfast and several local coffee shops). Rooms are very quiet, so you can sleep as much as you can. They stored our luggage on checkout and after a long warm day walking around in barcelona we were offered the chance to shower and change clothes at solarium/sauna area on the top floor... what a valuable surprise before heading to the airport for a long flight. Great hotel, great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: morelhunter_11
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Warwick Hotel in NYC a few years ago and loved it. So I wanted to try a Warwick owned hotel in Barcelona which is The Gallery Hotel. The location is perfectly situated in a great part of town. The breakfast buffet was excellent, loved the cured hams and pastries were warm and melted in your mouth. We were upgraded to a superior room which was clean, large and had a wonderful bathroom and great shower. The staff were outstanding. We were scheduled for a 12 day cruise and stayed at the hotel prior to leaving and upon return. On check out during first stay we asked attendant at front desk if she could get us a reservation at Drolma, a five star restaurant on our return date. When we checked in on our return they informed us that they indeed were successful in acquiring our reservation and also let us check in at 930 a.m. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Churchie11
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, wonderful room. Breakfast was impressive and just what was needed prior to a day exploring Barcelona. Located close to Rambla de Catalunya and a short walk to Las Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya. Also close to the Metro station, Diagonal. A very short walk to a couple of Gaudi's building on Passeig de Gracia - a great alternative route to walk to Plaza de Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel perfectly situated for the best of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LondonFoodie
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Gallery Hotel in Malaga so tried this one when visiting Barcelona early this year. The situation is excellent: close to transport and good bars and restaurants. There is free wifi and a sunny roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ebnic
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Breakfast is really delicious! Try the hams! Location is awesome, only a couple blocks from Plaza Catalunya. Staff is friendly and if you get a chance book it for New Years. Their New Year dinner is really great! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good stay, central location”
Reviews.Author: jenninen
Reviews.Content: + Location, location, location! Clean hotel, nice rooms, good breakfast. - Staff were a bit rude sometimes, they kept us waiting for the room key many times for like 5-10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug issues”
Reviews.Author: work2surf
Reviews.Content: Seamed like a reasonable hotel right in the heart of the action. Unfortunatley it took me more than 1 night to realize they had a MAJOR insect issue. Blood sucking bugs emerged from the headboard like some horror flick scene. Trip advisor is great in helping others and this is one hotel you want to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KarloMarlo
Reviews.Content: Overall very good 4 stars hotel. Big room, large bathroom. Despite the busy street in front of the hotel you will not hear a sound because of the two double paned windows. Wi-Fi is perfectly working in the room. Excellent location. 3 min walk to Gaudi La Pedrera and the nearest stop of Hop-On Hop-Off bus which is a must in Barcelona. 7 min to Casa Batllo. Lots of restaurants around. Great bakery just across the street to have a nice non expensive breakfast. The prestigious Passeig de Gràcia which is the major avenue with the most important shopping and business areas in Barcelona is literally around the corner. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't want to live in unreasonably expensive, crowded and pretty seedy La Rambla area but want to be strategically located to all city attractions. The only minor inconvenience is a heavy metal key to your room that you need to leave at reception before you are going out. These days the majority hotels around the world have a convenient plastic card key. But again, it's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: anid2010
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for four nights in August 2010. The location was great - easy access to subway and close to attractions. The neighbourhood itself is clean and safe. The hotel itself was nice. The staff were pleasant. There was a business centre with access to internet which was a bonus. My only complaint would be that the floor we were on smelled musty (as did our room). A look on the ceiling revealed what may have been water damage at some point (which may explain the mustiness). All this being said, the scent was not overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay and my first choice for any next time”
Reviews.Author: Jardaok
Reviews.Content: Maybe the biggest advantage of the hotel is that it has an excellent central location out of the crowd of ordinary tourists. Rooms are clean and comfortable, windows soundproof. Breakfast is relatively expensive and so it is certainly no mistake when you book without the breakfast - just across the street you find an excellent cafe/bistro where you can get fresh breakfast for less than half price. Free wifi is fine but you can be almost sure that you will experience some problems. However it is a disadvantage you can survive - the rest is fine. The hotel is not luxury but rooms have everything you need for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great No Frills Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: off2
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Not good if youŕe looking for luxury or a romantic getaway, but if you are looking for clean, helpful front desk and good location this is a good choice. As mentioned in some of the other reviews the "free" Wifi was spotty, but if you dont need access all day long than itś something you can deal with. The location is not right in the middle of everything, but I compared to more of a Madison Avenue type feel in regards to location and similar type shops nearby. The Metro is right close by and easy to use. You can take a short walk to the main section of Placa Catalunya. Lastly, the gym is not spectacular. No free weights, just a couple of iffy looking treadmills if thats important to you. Again the staff was great as I asked a million questions!

Reviews.Title: “great girls weekend away”
Reviews.Author: wheelies09
Reviews.Content: Travelled as group of ten women celebrating some 50th birthdays,hotel superb,very modern,decent location,could not fault much except wish we had had a kettle for tea making! Its provided in the executive rooms apparently. Good coffee shop over the road ideal for a continental breakfast or a nice bun. Or two! Would say check prices of your airport taxis as we were charged 30 euros from the airport but 42 euros going back! Would definitely recommend the tour bus,excellent value if you want to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, Front Desk was a Great Help”
Reviews.Author: snookypa
Reviews.Content: We were plesantly surprised at the Gallery Hotel- it was clean, modern, walking to attractions yet a bit off the busy areas and the front desk employees were really happy, and helpful! We had a group of 16 staying there from 12-75 years old and it was great! Thanks to everyone at the front desk- our dinner out on Good Friday when most were closed - was amazing at Trattoria Buoni Amici- ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Anesthetist55
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights at the Gallery Hotel. Overall a great hotel! Room average size, but large bath for Europe. Bath completely marble with a bathtub. Housekeeping excellent with impeccably clean rooms. Location less than half a block from Metro, the underground train that connects to anywhere in the city. Wonderful bakery across the street with awesome pastries and freshly-squeezed orange juice. Did not eat breakfast at the hotel because of the cost. Ate a very nice dinner one night at the hotel. Hotel is within walking distance of several Gaudi houses. Our two rooms were very quiet, but beds are hard. The beds are configured as two twins pushed together, but made up separately. Only inegative issue we had was accessing WIFI, which is free, but didn't work in our room. The desk was very helpful to come up and connect internet with a cable. Highly recommend a trip to Montserrat (monastery) and look up the Palau Musica de Barcelona if you like classical music concerts. Beautiful building!

Reviews.Title: “business and tourism”
Reviews.Author: SonrieLaVidaVuela
Reviews.Content: good quality, price and location for both business and tourism

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: leedailey
Reviews.Content: Very close to the center, excellent staff, dedicated and multilingual... for those of you guys who like to work out and relax... fitness room is not up to expectations and does not open till 8 but the sauna is not mixed and works well on demand. Breakfast is great and it is quiet...

Reviews.Title: “Good & Safe Location, nice hotel but overpriced for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: Rinaki16
Reviews.Content: Good location, vey close to Diagonal Metro Station and Passeig de Gracia street. About 20-25 minutes walk to the city centre (Catalunya square). The hotel is an average 4*, a bit overpriced (we paid Euro 130 per day excluding breakfast) and the rooms are basic but ok. Hotel Staff is very helpful. Housekeeping kept entering our room for the turn down service each afternoon while we were inside, although we where there just for a couple of hours. Business centre is free of charge. Needs to be refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KBMRiodejaneiro
Reviews.Content: Very nice and confortable hotel,friendly staff,wonderful food and best location in the city.Definitely,tha's a great hotel to stay.I recommend.And I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “best bargain in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: foodists
Reviews.Content: The Gallery Hotel turned out to be one of the best deals in Barcelona. We paid about $200/night for a mid-size, clean, modern room. The location was great for us in that we were very happy to stay out of the tourist-heavy districts (e.g., Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter). Yet, we were still close enough to so many great attractions and restaurants. (For any foodies out there, check out Gresca's tasting menu -- sublime!!) The subway/metro was a 3-minute walk from the hotel which gave us easy access to everything. For those who are accustomed to organized tours, etc., this may not be the ideal hotel. because it requires a bit more city-smarts and confidence to get to the main attractions. But anyone who is comfortable traveling w/out a stone-inscribed itinerary and has spent any significant time in a major urban area, this hotel is perfect. It was very easy to get a taxi and there are major shopping thoroughfares w/in a few blocks in just about any direction. The rooms, while modest, were spacious by European standards (i.e., by U.S. standards: imagine a Holiday Inn size room) and were clean w/ plenty of hot water. Yes, the area outside the hotel was under construction; yes, this is inconvenient. However, we were aware of this when we booked the hotel and were prepared for the minimal disruption. Negatives: internet access, though free, was a bit spotty and unreliable (not sure how much of this falls on the hotel or on Barcelona in general) and the front desk staff was not terribly knowledgeable as far as making suggestions or directions to more off-the-beaten-path places. Otherwise, we had a fabulous stay and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: meravb
Reviews.Content: Just came back from weekend in Barcelona, spending 4 nights at the Gallery hotel. What can I say – this is one of the best city 4 stars hotels I've been at. First of all, the location is great – just between Passeig de Gràcia and the av. Diagonal at a quite street nearby. We didn’t have breakfast, so Cortado (espresso with a bit of milk), croissants and small sandwiches at the cafés at the nearby Rambla de Catalunya were enough. The room had modern and looks-new furniture, bathroom was wide and clean. We had wifi, safe, full mini-bar and even stereo-disk system (although we didn’t use it). The staff was very friendly, answered to many questions  We were in Barcelona during the Merce festival – and the hotel's location was great for it – in quite surrounding away from the big fuss – but 3 stations away at the Metro from the action in the Barri Gotic, Born and El Raval quarters…… There is also very nice public garden behind the hotel. All and all – excellent hotel, best value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: lazblue
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Barcelona and stayed at the Gallery Hotel for 3 nights.... got a great deal where we got one night stay for free if we stayed more than 2 nights, which made the room rate very reasonable. The hotel is located in the middle of town which shopping and most sights within walking distance or short ride on the metro. We caught the train from Barcelona Airport to Passeig De Gracia and then walked a few blocks to the hotel without issues. Construction of the metro is almost complete so there were no noise issues. There's a good little bakery directly across the road to grab breakfast. We got a room on top floor which was large and comfortable with all of the required facilities, including free wifi. The only improvement I would suggest is an electric kettle in the room. Reception staff were friendly and I would definitely stay here again next time we're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a couple of years previously and was very impressed then. Two years later on I still think it is a great city centre hotel. The reception area is clean and welcoming and the location is great for seeing barcelona and for the public transport system (should only be about 24 euros from airport in taxi). The rooms are a good size clean and have all the facilities that you would expect from a four star hotel. The internet is free (if it is working which it wasn't for most of my stay). Breakfast isn't great value for money but the cafe two doors down does a good cheaper breakfast. The bar again, is expensive but has a lovely outside area. The gym is small and uncomfortably hot in summer and there is sadly no pool but a nice roof terrace . If I was looking for a hotel in Barcelona again I would be more than happy to visit here for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomric122
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona for three nights and chose the Gallery Hotel because of its excellent location, next to the Diagonal Metro and near the main sights of the modernisme movement. Our room was very cool, comfortable and quiet with a spacious bathroom. The breakfast (included) was outstandingly good.and served in a pleasant outdoor courtyard. All the hotel staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. In particular the reception manager went out of his way to help us when using the business centre. All in all - thoroughlt recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping over the underground”
Reviews.Author: Boldizsar
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from centre, very close to shops, restaurants, to casa batllo and casa milo. Nice decoration, modern room. Unfortunately the very idea of an accommodation, i.e. sleeping is not possible as metro (underground, subway) roams just under your bed. We booked directly with the hotel and they forgot to mention that there was a major construction around the hotel. Which is temporarily and we could have slept as works begun at 7 only.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: tomwoon81
Reviews.Content: Was in Barcelona in April this year for my honeymoon, and stayed at the Gallery Hotel for 6 nights. A nice and modern hotel with great location. Right at the Diagonals with access to many restaurants, cafes and shopping malls. 3 minute walk to the nearest metro station and perhaps 2 minutes to one of Gaudi's famous buildings. Bakery just opposite the hotel main door - great for breakfast or just something to munch on. Nice rooms with free wireless internet connection, plasma tv, ipod dock and the other usual frills one would associate with a pleasant stay. Can't find a reason to fault the hotel or the staff who were friendly and helpful throughout. Will definitely return to The Gallery hotel when back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: TrojanTraveler98
Reviews.Content: As a frequent international traveler I am sorry to report about poor hotel service especially related to credit card fraud. While staying at the Gallery Hotel in Barcelona I received an early wakeup call I had requested from the front desk and they also asked me to please confirm my credit card information. After going for a jog I realized the wake-up call came an hour before the time I had requested. When I asked the front desk about the suspicious call they said they had not called and that there were no calls patched through to our room. Fortunately I had a witness that the phone did ring, however the hotel staff, including management ,were absolutely horrible to deal with and rather than being helpful they suggested I dreamt the call. Due to this event and the terrible attitudes of the hotel staff I invite people to look elsewhere for a hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location is well worth the reduced price”
Reviews.Author: Torsika
Reviews.Content: There was nothing extraordinary about the room itself, just furnished in a minimalist style, which I prefer when on holiday for the sake of cleanliness. We were on the fifth floor and were unable to get access to the Internet, which had been previously promised, so we had to move down with our laptop to the lobby each night to get in touch with family members through Skype (which must have looked silly...). I was keen on the breakfast room and the selection there for three days, but the food certainly lacked variety. What I really liked was its easy access to the neighbouring garden, where we were stunned by some orange trees and stuff. The best thing to be mentioned should definitely be its location, with lots of attractions within walking distance and near public transportation. (Yes, roadworks are still going on, and consequently I saw a rat (!) emerging from the tunnel every night! Urghh..) Get a reduction, otherwise it won't be worth the 4-star rate!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: csm2000
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty tiny for the price. The bathroom was quite nice and the wood fixtures seemed to add a lot. There is still construction going on in front of the hotel so traffic access is closed. There was a bit of jackhammer noise one late afternoon/early evening, just annoying for a jet lag nap but quiet place at night. Access tp Metro and bus is just a couple of minutes walk. Good spot to walk to alot of major attractions. Did not eat anything aside from appetizers at the bar - the staff was a bit aloof, but it was a comfortable place to chill out after a day of running all over the city. It's got a nice lobby, but past that, is rather ordinary. They do seem to have some good deals going on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not great quality”
Reviews.Author: JohnFR99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value and a well worth 3 stars, but don't see what could make it a 4 star. We arrived quite late at 11pm and the hotel could not advise us of where to eat, telling us everywhere was opened until 1 am, but after going around, we found out restaurants stopped serving well earlier than that. The hotel could not offer food, as the restaurant closes at 11pm and they didn't seem to accommodate outside that. Our room was on the first floor and as soon as you come out of the lift, a horrible smell is present in the hall (gone off fish or drainage below?). The room was fine, two single beds altough it says online you can book a double bed, and I also requested it in the booking! The room is more like a hotel chain room of 3 stars, as there was nothing great about it. On the last day, I was staying for work and asked the reception for bus or train to go to Reus airport, and they only came up with one option, which was a bus 3 times a day (obviously not matching the times of flights!). So at the last minute I had to send her on a taxi... following morning they told me they had found another way to get there!!! a bit late. Overall, good cheap hotel, but doesn't really deserve 4 stars. It is a good base for shopping, altough far enough from Las Ramblas, but don't expect a great hotel! Would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: lisa4ian
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in very good location, walkable to all key sights and good restaurants. Breakfast was included in the room rate which was good value. Good spread of things to choose from, eggs, selection of cold meats, cheese, bread and pastries. Only negative is that the bed was on the hard side, but all the other bathroom extras like slippers, bathrobes, shoe polish etc made up for it. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: majur
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for our needs. We were a group who were in Barcelona to see the sights, shop and go out for nice meals...and maybe a few drinks. The hotel was quite, clean and a great location. We wanted to be central, but in a quiet area... we were only 15 mins from The Rambla. Even better, the metro was only 2 mins walk, with a direct line to the Rambla/Port (€1.20). NB Watch the pick-pocket groups on the metro. Hotel room was lovely. Comfortable, firm beds. Loads of wee bits, like bath robes, umbrella, toothbrush, minibar (free still water) and an i-pod station. Some of our group have little variations. The leisure facilities were...well, they shouldn't have bothered. Stuck up in the attic room/corridor. That's not why we were there so that didn't matter. We didn't have breakfast in our package, but no need. There was a great little cafe across the street...great fresh orange juice. We ate two nights in restaurants a few doors from the hotel. As a group, the one closest was great, easy going and serves late. The other, on the corner, was a little dearer, but nice food too. The area did lack late bars, especially for older people looking for a quite drink. Around the gothic area would be better. Overall, a great hotel. We paid about €60 pppn + 7% tax.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, location, price”
Reviews.Author: WarsawWanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our expectations in every way: a decent 4 -star hotel, well-maintained (tho showing minor signs of age), reasonably well located, with a few nice touches (e.g. free CD of easy listening and a CD-player) , at a good price (considering the city is fairly expensive), with helpful staff. Tip: ask for a room "overlooking the garden" (NOT the courtyard), which shelters you from the street noise (expecially with the subway construction ongoing in front, expected to last well into 2009). Transit tip: avoid a train-metro correspondence transiting from the airport to the hotel, as it is poorly indicated (and we were almost pick-pocketed in our confusion getting onto the metro). Instead, get off the train at Passeig de Gracia station and walk the 4 big blocks up to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location... Hated the Bed!”
Reviews.Author: Bifford
Reviews.Content: You can not ask for a better location... the hotel is between two major streets - Catalunya (which turns into La Rambla) and Passeig de Gracia (which has some of the best and high-end shopping in Barcelona). The hotel is steps away from the Metro and a very short walking distance to: La Rambla (8 mins), many of Gaudi's buildings such as Casa Mila (5 mins) and Casa Ballto (10 mins), the Gothic region (15 mins) and a lot of great restaurants which can be found along Catalunya (going south) and Passeig de Gracia (going North). As well, there are many bakeries and sandwich shops within minutes. There have been reviews that mention construction in front of the hotel... yes there is construction, but we could not hear a thing with the window shut. The windows were extremely sound proof. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, particularly with regards to restaurants. Breakfast at the hotel was included with our room rate - well worth it, especially the chocolate donuts. The hotel room is a decent size, especially for European standards. The rooms look exactly like the photos online, so no surprises, and the bathrooms are modern. Now for the beds... aside from having two twin beds pushed together (which seems to be common in Spain), the beds were HARD. If you don't want two separate beds pushed together, you must request a king bed at booking. If you want a non-hard bed, don't stay here! The Wi-Fi wasn't the greatest... which didn't bod well with us, since we were traveling for a mobile conference. The hotel should have been better prepared. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent helpful staff, good clean room & good choice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: welshbookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gallery for a weekend city break and were impressed by this Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful to us as this was our first visit to Barcelona (hopefully not last!) Our double room was not ready until 2pm, but this wasnt a problem and we went for a walk to the harbour (tip - take comfortable walking shoes with you!). There are lots of streets to walk past, as well as Las Ramblas and a really good indoor market full of fresh fruit/veg/meats and fish. There are lots of bakeries, nice restaurants, tapas bars around the area and an excellent metro system, directly opposite the hotel. The room was very modern, spacious and clean - all you would want for a weekend break, and the breakfast had a good choice, with the fruit juices, fresh fruit & cold meats being regularly replaced when used up. Only 1 minor gripe, there was no tea making facilty in the room which would have been nice. Just take your own kettle if you`re partial to a cuppa. I would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent all-rounder!”
Reviews.Author: DaveRJS
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel, our rooms were not ready. 45 minutes (and 5 complimentary drinks!) later we received the keys to our double and single rooms. These were clean, adequately furnished and very comfortable. Yes, the single room was on the small side, but it was a single room... Our double room overlooked the front of the hotel; the Diagonal Metro station is under construction resulting in only pedestrian access to the front. This reduced traffic noise but increased construction noise. Having said that, with the windows closed, the sound-proofing is excellent, both from the outside and between rooms. The staff are very friendly and professional. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome and answer our questions on the local area. Breakfast was delicious and consisted of continental and cooked options. Smoked salmon, scrambled eggs and chocolate doughnuts were particular favorites! The hotel is located next to the Metro which makes exploring the city extremely easy. It is also within walking distance of Las Ramblas and Passeig de Gracia. Overall I was extremely happy with my stay at the Gallery Hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: BowBell
Reviews.Content: Comfortable modern hotel with great location off northern end of Passeig de Gracia. If you are travelling alone don't book the single rooms, they are tiny. Opt instead for a double which is very spacious. The hotel doesn't offer luxury but it is modern, comfortable and clean, and considering its location, offers excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Guy_1204
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the 'El Classico' in Barcelona. I stayed 3 nights at the Gallery hotel, and It was great. The hotel has the best location. Just around the corner you can find 2 subway lines, the 2 Bus Turistic lines and one of Gaudi's houses. All major sites are within walking distance. After comparing the prices I found the best offer in the hotel's website - www.galleryhotel.com. Most of their offers ware the same as Booking.Com's & the other booking sites, but they also had a unique offer that included breakfast for 2 for 10 Euros a day (for the 2 !). And... the breakfast was good. I'll be going there again the next time I'm going to see FCB plays ! Enjoy, Guy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break”
Reviews.Author: chattypops
Reviews.Content: We went to The Gallery in Barcelona for our Wedding Anniversary, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return. Good Hotel in a great location, especially for all the expensive designer shops and good restaurants. If you want tea & Coffee making in your room you will have to upgrade or take your own as we do ! The rooms are quite contemporary and have lovely marble bathrooms . The Hotel service was first class and the buffet breakfast wonderful with lots to choose from. The tourist bus stop is just round the corner for both the blue & red route, can 100% recommend the tourist bus. The only negative was that they are working on the Metro so you could not get a taxi to the Hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Great at the Gallery”
Reviews.Author: Cazza39
Reviews.Content: This was a 40th birthday pressie to my husband and our first trip to Barcelona. Choosing a hotel out of the many listed is daunting but this seemed a good standard in central location without remortgaging! Was pleasantly surprised when we arrived (expected it to be smaller) but the service we had was fabulous (never seen a bell-boy before) Quick check-in and our bags safely deposited in our room for us. Double room was spacious, clean , warm and very contemporary. Only drawback was 2 singles pushed together (wd have preferred a double) Again bathroom was large and all marble with a great selection of tolietries for you. Bath robes, slippers and hairdryer were supplied for us too. Room service was quick and efficient and we sat out on a night to the rear of the hotel in their patio area - heaters were supplied- and we had a few drinks before bed. Staff all helpful and curtious.We were allowed to store our bags until we left for home at 3pm. which was a great benefit. Overall it was an excellent hotel in a great central location with everything you need and I wouldnt hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Was impressed”
Reviews.Author: bananana
Reviews.Content: Overall really enjoyed our time at the Gallery hotel and would come back again. Location The hotel is in the pretty Eixample district, which is not super touristy or tackly (like Las Ramblas and the Gothic quarter), so quite enjoyed that. The Diagonal metro station is half a minute away from the hotel – v handy. Also the Passeig de Gracia metro station is about 10 mins walk away. Gaudi’s buildings (La Pedrera and Casa Battlo) are walking distance – 5-10 mins away from the hotel. There 2 boulevards near the hotel (Passeig de Gracia and Rambla) have plenty of nice cafes. Rooms Very comfortable and nicely decorated. Especially enjoyed the small touches – little chocolates on our pillows, free water, an umbrella to use during your stay. I’ve read on the forum that you can hear the subway (as the hotel is above the subway tracks) - we had a room on the 1st floor and was aware when a metro would pass underneath, but couldn’t say it was disturbing. Service Front desk were nice and friendly. Also I specifically asked for a room with double bed and we got one on arrival – I was pleased they did their best to fullfil customer’s requests. Breakfast Did not have breakfast at the hotel, but instead went to the pastry shop just opposite the hotel. Garden The have a big garden at the back, I imagine this is quite nice during the summer Other Because of works near the hotel (we were there for the weekend when there was no work going on, so weren’t disturbed by the works) it was quite difficult for the taxi driver to find the temporary entrance to the hotel…Would suggest asking the hotel exactly how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Izzybee
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only had two nights in Barcelona, but, fortunately we were able to spend them at the Gallery Hotel. The staff was very helpful, the room was spacious, modern and very clean and the breakfast was excellent. The location was great - a short walk to Las Ramblas and many other attractions. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: CP08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value for money, it was clean, modern and comfortable and in a good location within waliking distance of the main attractions but away from the traffic and noise. There are roadworks right outside the hotel but this did not cause any problems, my room was on the second floor and there was no noise. The rooms all varied slightly... I booked 3 double rooms, one had a double bed and the other two had singles pushed together, but this was not a problem. One room had a tea and coffee tray and a kettle, the others did not. One room had slippers and dressing gowns, the others did not. One had a DVD player etc - each room had slightly different things in it, but the basics were provided in all rooms, it just seemed to be pot luck which additional extras you got! The staff were helpful and we were able to store our bags in the hotel for no extra charge. We had breakfast there one day, and the buffet was expensive (E17) but very enjoyable! We all loved the hotel, and it was very good value for money. Barcelona is a fantastic city with loads to see and do, we had a very enjoyable trip. One word of warning, there are a lot of pick pockets, especially on the metro, and they do target tourists. Despite our best efforts we still managed to fall victim to this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: maire242
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 5 night stay at the Gallery. the hotel was very clean and the staff always ready to help. The only downfall was the roadworks outside but we had a room at the back so did not hear any noise. We had breakfast on our last day for ease and it was ok but you can get it a lot cheaper from one of the many cafe's near by Hotel is about a 15/20min walk to the Ramblas and this we were gratefull for, some of the hotels nearer must have been noisy at night as at 1am the streets were still very busy with tourist. The metro is very close to the hotel and my advice is to buy a T10 ticket for 7.20 euros ( this is for 10 single trips and you can use the ticket on the bus as well as the train ) If you are only going to Barcelona for a few days make the most of your stay and get a ticket for the city tour bus( 20 euro's for one day ticket & 26 euro's for 2 days ) this way you will get to see all the main sights and you can hop on and of when you want, The zoo is a must to visit, it's one of the best i have been to

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: McGherks
Reviews.Content: This hotel situated at a great location! Only mins away from Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. Close to the metro and bus stops which means it is very convenient to all attractions. Although there was major road works outside the hotel, the double windows were sound-proof and we couldn't hear any construction noise in the room! Service was great and managed to provide us whatever we need, LAN cable, adaptor, etc. Didn't try the restaurant as it was a bit pricey (the only down side) but then there were several good restaurants and cafe nearby which can definitely fill you up. Booked through lastminute.com and cost us about £360 for 3 nights. Definitely highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveolve
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and had good rates. Its in a good location. The only downside is there is construction right outside the hotel. This might be why the rates are low right now. I would stay here again as long as I could get as good a deal as I did this past time.

Reviews.Title: “Grate”
Reviews.Author: Whatelse76
Reviews.Content: Got a good price at hotels.com on this hotel (90 euros pr nigth for a double room). Because of our late check-in, there was no doubles left. They gave us a suite for the same price :) This suite was very nice. The staff was very helpful, and there was a business-center i the basement with 2 pc's with internet free to use. Very nice terrace with sunbeds on the roof of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ... A Great location”
Reviews.Author: georgia84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from the Gallery hotel and we will be definately going back. The location is superb, so close to the Gaudi buildings and within walking distance to all the major attractions, not to mention some of the best shopping. The staff were friendly and always willing to help with recommendations for restaurants, cafes etc. I would definately recommend this as an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EveMarie_Ianick
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gallery for 3 days and it was just perfect ! The room are nice and well equiped, the staff is very very helpful and friendly but the best of all is the LOCATION ! It was perfect, so near the ramblas and the shops and the great tapas bar ! We loved it " Food was very good too ! We had breakfast included in our plan and it was very good !

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Max25
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to be in - close to great restaurants and high-end shopping, but handily just a touch further north than the mad goings-on of La Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya. The hotel is chic modern European business-style. Good fittings and attention to detail, rooms just big enough, nice amenities, good aircon, tasteful safe decor. Breakfast surprisingly worthwhile and helpful and friendly cafe/bar staff who were eager to please any time day or night. Spacious outside terrace for meals/drinks with nice touches like complimentary snacks. Concierge a little clueless on restaurant recommendations, but not a big deal when BCN has so much to offer within a close radius. So not a definitive or exceptionally memorable hotel, but one that will completely meet your needs for a great Barcelona weekend and at a price that's definitely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - be advised there is road work in progress”
Reviews.Author: poisson54
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gallery for four nights in February. Very nice...clean, quiet, great staff. Be advised that there is construction work going on for the rest of this year (2008). I think they are expanding the underground tunnel of the Diagonal metro stop. As a result, the road in front of the hotel is blocked off, and if you are taking a taxi to the hotel, you should ask to be dropped at the Passeig de Gracia taxi stand at the end of Rosello. It's about a 100-meter walk to the hotel. When you check out, the bellman will take your bags to teh taxi stand for you. I suspect it is noisy during the day, so if you expect to be in bed during working hours, get a room in the back. For a real treat, ask the bartender to mix up a pitcher of sangria (2 persons minimum). His recipe is unique and it was the best we had in two weeks in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: RSSL
Reviews.Content: Barcelona: Gallery Hotel Date: January 28, 2008 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, São Paulo Brasil Gallery is the perfect choice for your vacations. The hotel is very nice, modern and cozy. Every details are fancy. The location is wonderful, very near to Passeig de Gracia and many others interesting points. Thanks Gallery Hotel and your staff for my lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: On_the_move_365
Reviews.Content: We booked it through Octopus Travel. Very central hotel in Barcelona. If going back to Barcelona, we would stay here again. -10 mins walk from Catalunya Square/Ramblas -Diagonal Metro stop 1min walk from Hotel. It links to 2-3 lines, so can get to anywhere in the city easily. -From Airport get the train to "Estacio Sants" (25min journey time and they go every half hour). Then get blue line (L5) from Estacio Sants to Diagonal Metro Station -We didn't need to use a taxi at all during our stay!!! -Official Barcelona tour bus stop also 2mins walk from Hotel -Breakfast in Hotel was great and good range of food. -Desk staff very helpful -Free internet use in Hotel's business centre. -Third floor is smoking rooms, so in advance we emailed the hotel requesting non-smoking room and it was granted. While in Barcelona the must see places are: (1) Nou Camp Stadium, but bring cash as no bank machines and ticket desk could not facilitate VISA (with PIN no) use. Tour is very good. Great Barca megastore (2) Montjuic park (lovely views) - Check out Pueblo Espanyol...8euro in an full of authentic buildings, with craft shops, cafes etc (3) "Born" area for nice cocktail bars. (4) Harbour area, Port Vell (lovely walkway) (5) Olympic Park in Monjuric. Musemn closed on Sundays. (6) St Joseph's Market (Off Las Ramblas, beside Dunkin Coffee!!!) Only bigger bars in Barcelona are smoke free, i.e. they have a smoking section. The small bars are full of smoke, especially when we are used to the smoking ban here in Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gallery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4fab
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Gallery Hotel two weeks ago. Super friendly and helpful staff- immaculate housekeeping! The hotel exceeded our expectations- spacious rooms, a beautiful view from room, chocolates on pillows and complimentary water in small fridge. We also loved the location- easy access to metro but most of the time we took off on foot to explore Barcelona. Also in a great neighborhood- felt very safe and even walked home from a bar 6 blocks away at 4AM with nary a worry. We were on 5 th floor and never even remotely heard the metro- our room was very quiet. We had friends in room next to us and never heard their TV, phone or shower. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Parking”
Reviews.Author: Panna
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Gallery Hotel, I would like to advise that you need to request a room with a window, my brother and his partner didn't get a window room and it was very dark. Breakfast was fine, parking at the hotel was a bonus, Staff were very friendly and helpful.. The hotel is in a good area, and everything was within walking distant, although there is a metro stop right by the hotel to. We bought a day ticket for the tourist site stop bus which was very good value as you could hop on and off as much as you liked.

Reviews.Title: “simply briiliant location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: polo22
Reviews.Content: Just stayed from Nov 24-26 in the Hotel Gallery. Excellent location, with the 2 Diagonal metros lines within 100 metres of the hotel. Hotel is exactly like the website, the rooms are nicely, modern decorated and beds and linen very comfortable - I got a room on the back of the hotel, which is better than a front road view as it is quite busy. reception staff and concierge are very helpful as well. Hotel is idea for sports fans going to Camp Nou, take the Green line at Diagonal, it is only 30 mn journey , direct . Bar is cosy, service is great , and not that expensive for four stars Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “4 day weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: LondonLippy
Reviews.Content: Before booking the hotel I reviewed the comments on Tripadvisor and the average score was Excellent which meant that our expectations were high. The hotel lived up to those expectations and it was fantastic. We had a room at the back of the hotel. It was very quiet and as the rooms are sound proofed you did not hear any neighbours. The room was a good size with flat screen television (Various english channels) For breakfast you could have a full english, fresh fruit, toast, pastries, cheese and meats, cereals and freshly squeezed fruit juices. Plus coffee, tea or chocolate! The staff were efficient and helpful. The location was within walking distance of all the main sites and next to the diaginal tube station. The cost was around £256 for 3 nights for 2 people, including breakfast. It was worth paying the extra!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmarteCookie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked here for a girly trip to Barcelona in July. Hotel is in a good location, easy walk from the Diagonal station. They also have parking. Location is out of the super touristy area, so it is a bit quieter. Hotel staff was nice, and the breakfast was basic but good. Only complaint was that the room was not nearly as posh, clean, and nice as other reviewers had led me to believe. Carpet was stained, there was some mold in the shower, and overall the room was rather dark - and we were on a top floor. I had a discount through the travel agent, so it made for good value. Not sure how I would feel if I had paid the rack rate though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bocey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from barcelona and the Gallery hotel. The hotel is in a great location, just at the top of The Ramblas. This end of The Ramblas is a lot quieter and is in the up market shopping district. There are plenty of places to eat at this end if you wanted to keep away from the rush, but it is only a 5-10 min walk to the start of the busy ramblas area and a further 35 mins to the bottom by the port. We went with our 2 children ( 12 and 8) and they loved it. The Tapas bars are endless and are superb, many of them also serve pizza's and steak which was great for the kids. The hotel is very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We never really used any of the other amenities because we were out all day sight seeing. There is a tube station only 30metres from the hotel and you can get anywhere in barcelona very easily and cheaply on the tube(metro) We were in barcelona for 5 days and spent a couple on the beach and the rest sightseeing. The beach is only 15 mins tube journey away, and was a nice rest for the kids. Alot of the great buildings are only 1-2 stops on the tube away from the hotel, Casa Milla is only a stone throw away. We were lucky enough to get tickets to a FC Barcelona to watch them play Inter Milan. WOW what a stadium, it was full 100,000 people. If you like football this is a must, my wife doesn't but she loved it. We got tickets direct from FC barcelona website and chose our seats online, and collected tickets from ticket office the night of the match. We went to the match by tube, it was busy,but the atmosphere was electric. i would defineatly recomend this hotel and Barcelona for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location And Comfort - Gallery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fontcar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the first time in Barcelona at the Gallery Hotel in July 2007. This hotel is an excellent place to stay. It offers good rates - comfortable and spacious rooms at the perfect location. Passeo de Gracia is a luxurious setting close to some of Gaudi's creation and excellent for a good shopping day. It also has nice lunch and dinner options at walking distance. The location is very safe to stay in and it felt safe even during late hours in the evening or early morning. No pickpocketing at all!! Located just 1 minute from the metro it's excellent because as a tourist you can travel to anywhere in the city. For the price, we had all the comforts we are used to when traveling at the right location. We met the hotel general manager at the lobby several times during the week and loved the attention to detail and availability to answer any questions we had. Good service as well. Photos in internet are the same as how the rooms look like when we arrived. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Barcelona.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: morewine4me
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with great service - modern style rooms and a great continental breakfast. Stayed for 4 nights - no complaints and i'll happily stay there again. Great location by the Diagonal metro station. The gaudi house can be seen from the end of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gallery Hotel for 3 nights for vacation. It is a lovely hotel in a great area. The hotel itself is a block away from the hot OMM Hotel off of Passeig de Garcia. It is incredibly convenient to all of the luxury shops on that street (which all close on Sundays). Plus, you aren't in the heart of the tourist area. There is also a lovely little bakery across the street that is great for breakfast or lunch. I booked my room through Expedia, but emailed the hotel directly to confirm my reservation and give them my room preferences. They were very quick to respond and made sure I had a quiet room, with a king bed that was non-smoking. I checked into room 405 and it was exactly what I had asked for. The rooms are beautifully decorated and comfy. The bed was very comfortable and not as firm as some of the other hotels I stayed in during my time Spain. The linens, towels, robes and slippers are all of nice quality. They have safes in the closet that are free of charge. The safe is larger than most and will easily accommodate a laptop. The mini bar was well stocked, but a little on the pricey side for the level of hotel. The room service is tasty. It is 24 hours, but after midnight they only serve sandwiches. I found it to be reasonably priced. The CD player is a nice touch and they provide a nice relaxing music CD for you. The bathroom amenities are probably the best part of the hotel. I was shocked how many items they provide (i.e. razor and shaving cream, toothbrushes and toothpaste, etc.) NOTE: Even with all the extras they do provide, they do not have conditioner or body lotion. You will need to bring your own. The hotel has a nice business center with two computers and a printer. It is really handy and free of charge. It is great for checking in online and printing out your boarding passes. The hotel called me a cab for an early morning flight and they were very efficient and helpful. The cab to the airport cost 25 Euros. The location of the hotel is a little farther to some of the tourist areas than other hotels. However, there are several metro stops near the hotel and the metro was really easy to use. It is also on the line that takes you to the FC Barcelona stadium. If you are going to Barcelona for a football match...this is a great place to stay. It is really convenient to the Camp Nou. Overall, this is the kind of hotel I love. It is beautifully decorated, quiet, and effiecient. It is great for a vacation or for business. I highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Gallery Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Rosello 249, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
